intro: Carduus polyanthos, commonly known as the multibract eupatorium, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of numerous tiny florets. The plant typically grows to a height of 1 to 3 meters, featuring robust stems and serrated, hairy leaves. Its showy purple or pink flower heads bloom in late summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. The plant is often found in meadows, roadsides, and disturbed soils, and it has been used in traditional herbal medicine for its purported health benefits.
